alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Somerset, western Wicomico and southeastern Dorchester Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lawsonia, or 16 miles southwest of Princess Anne, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salisbury, Fruitland, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Salisbury University, Delmar, Hebron, Vienna, Lawsonia, Westover, Marion Station, Mardela Springs, Whitehaven, Wetipquin, Trinity, Eden, Kingston, Mount Vernon, Green Hill and Catchpenny. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
